docs.snippet: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 25 -- The Argentine proposal, under which a single nation could veto collective hemispheric action against an aggressor, was killed today by a 16-to-1 vote of the Inter-American Defense Conference's commission No. 3.
docs.lead_paragraph: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 25 -- The Argentine proposal, under which a single nation could veto collective hemispheric action against an aggressor, was killed today by a 16-to-1 vote of the Inter-American Defense Conference's commission No. 3.
docs.abstract: comm kills Argentine proposal for veto; agrees on two-thirds vote; line-up; Argentina yields; subcom drafts aggression rept; said to bar dual principle

headline.main: TREATY VETO PLAN LOST BY ARGENTINA AT RIO CONFERENCE; Commission Kills It, 16 to 1 -- Two-thirds Vote Agreed On for Collective Action

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: The military uprising in Ecuador that unseated the elected President, Jose Maria Velasco Ibarra, was understandably upsetting to the representatives of the American countries meeting at Petropolis to frame a hemisphere defense treaty. The happenings...
docs.lead_paragraph: The military uprising in Ecuador that unseated the elected President, Jose Maria Velasco Ibarra, was understandably upsetting to the representatives of the American countries meeting at Petropolis to frame a hemisphere defense treaty. The happenings at Quito are not germane to the conferences at Petropolis, however, except as they raised a question as to the credentials of the Ecuadorian delegation.
docs.abstract: ed on effect of Ecuadorean coup, aggression moves, attempt to frame treaty so that Canada will be free to sign and possible change of date for Truman visit

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Switzerland, Aug. 27 -- The United Nations Special Committee of Inquiry on Palestine voted six to four today in favor of some kind of Palestine confederation, with a central economic administration to be imposed on the "states."
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Switzerland, Aug. 27 -- The United Nations Special Committee of Inquiry on Palestine voted six to four today in favor of some kind of Palestine confederation, with a central economic administration to be imposed on the "states."

headline.main: U.N. UNIT OPPOSES FEDERAL PALESTINE; Inquiry Committee Votes 6-4 in Favor of Confederation With Central Economic Rule

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 27 -- With buyers still inclined to await publication of the Government's austerity plans, the stock markets here today generally were quiet.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 27 -- With buyers still inclined to await publication of the Government's austerity plans, the stock markets here today generally were quiet.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Trading Is Generally Quiet as Government's New Austerity Plans Are Awaited

byline.original: Special to The NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Aug. 28 -- The question whether colonial powers should furnish information on "political progress" as well as social and economic data concerning their non-self-governing territories provoked a long argument in the United Nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Aug. 28 -- The question whether colonial powers should furnish information on "political progress" as well as social and economic data concerning their non-self-governing territories provoked a long argument in the United Nations today.

headline.main: U.N. POWERS DIFFER ON COLONIAL DATA; Proposal to Give Information on 'Political Progress' Stirs Lengthy Controversy

byline.original: By GEORGE E. JONESSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 29 -- The Inter-American conference in its plenary session today declared unanimously that the hemispherc security, which it has now almost completed, shall not be used as excuse for an armaments race between the American...
docs.lead_paragraph: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 29 -- The Inter-American conference in its plenary session today declared unanimously that the hemispherc security, which it has now almost completed, shall not be used as excuse for an armaments race between the American states.

headline.main: AMERICAS' TREATY TO BAR ARMS RACE; Plenary Session at Petropolis Adopts Affirmation Ruling Out 'Excessive' Forces

byline.original: By C.P. TRUSSELLSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WORD came from London last week that Stanley Gibbons, Ltd., publishers of the British standard postage stamp catalogue, had announced that it would not chronicle the recent postal paper which Hungary and San Marino issued in honor of Franklin D....
docs.lead_paragraph: WORD came from London last week that Stanley Gibbons, Ltd., publishers of the British standard postage stamp catalogue, had announced that it would not chronicle the recent postal paper which Hungary and San Marino issued in honor of Franklin D. Roosevelt, and that as dealers the firm would not handle the stamps.

headline.main: NEWS OF THE WORLD OF STAMPS; Steps Are Taken to Stop Speculation Through Monopoly Practices
ARGENTINE PRESS BACKED; Writers in Brazil Pledge Aid to Suppressed Papers There

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Switzerland, Aug. 30 (AP) -- Delegates to the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine said tonight that Paul Mohn, a Swedish alternate delegate, had proposed a compromise on boundaries for the proposed partitioning of Palestine between...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Switzerland, Aug. 30 (AP) -- Delegates to the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine said tonight that Paul Mohn, a Swedish alternate delegate, had proposed a compromise on boundaries for the proposed partitioning of Palestine between Arabs and Jews.

headline.main: PALESTINE AREAS HELD DELINEATED; U.N. Inquiry Is Reported Likely to Accept a Compromise on Proposed State Boundaries
